perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree that the territory of such engagement shall be worldwide (the "Territory").
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree that the territory of such engagement shall be (the "Territory").
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase "worldwide", the contract still uses the defined term "Territory" but the geographical scope is now undefined and unclear. Later clauses rely on this definition, introducing uncertainty in enforcement of territorial rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in this Agreement, Naked shall have an exclusive right and license in the Territory to use Athlete's name, nickname, initials, autograph, image, likeness, photographs, biographical details, facsimile signature, voice, videos, electronic media depictions, any words, symbols or other depictions, as well as any other identifying attributes that would identify Athlete to the public, including any trade mark(s), copyrights which Wade has, as set forth on Schedule A attached hereto, and all multimedia assets that Wade owns or has right to use (collectively, the "Wade Image") solely for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products) in the Territory as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in this Agreement, Naked shall have an exclusive right and license to use Athlete's name, nickname, initials, autograph, image, likeness, photographs, biographical details, facsimile signature, voice, videos, electronic media depictions, any words, symbols or other depictions, as well as any other identifying attributes that would identify Athlete to the public, including any trade mark(s), copyrights which Wade has, as set forth on Schedule A attached hereto, and all multimedia assets that Wade owns or has right to use (collectively, the "Wade Image") solely for the advertising, endorsement, promotion, or sale of the Naked Products (including the Wade Products).
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase "in the Territory", Naked's license to use Athlete's image and likeness becomes geographically ambiguous, in direct contrast with the original intention as outlined in section 1. This creates contradictions with other sections that mention Territory or use thereof, potentially leading to legal disputes over usage rights across different regions.

perturbation.original_text: All rights to the use of the names, trademarks, service marks, symbols, logos, domain names, trade secrets, confidential know-how, patents, copyrights, any pending applications with respect to any of the foregoing, and any other intellectual property and related proprietary rights, interests and protections ("Intellectual Property Rights") in connection with Wade Products will be jointly owned by Wade and Naked. Wade will retain all ownership of the Intellectual Property Rights in connection with Wade Image including, for the avoidance of doubt, the Logo.
perturbation.changed_text: All rights to the use of the names, trademarks, service marks, symbols, logos, domain names, trade secrets, confidential know-how, patents, copyrights, any pending applications with respect to any of the foregoing, and any other intellectual property and related proprietary rights, interests and protections ("Intellectual Property Rights") in connection with Wade Products will be jointly owned by Wade and Naked.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase "Wade will retain all ownership of the Intellectual Property Rights in connection with Wade Image including, for the avoidance of doubt, the Logo.", section 14 now contradicts schedule A by stating it is jointly owned where schedule A says Wade trademarks and copyrights, thus making enforceability ambiguous.
